entry.title: Identity and Time References
entry.content:
This is a link to an article in the Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy called Identity Over Time. It is some background reference for some things I want to write about. I plan to update this with some more links.

Gallois, Andre, "Identity Over Time", The Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy (Winter 2016 Edition), Edward N. Zalta (ed.), URL = https://plato.stanford.edu/archives/win2016/entries/identity-time/

entry.title: Majestic Unfolding Nature
entry.content:
Bugs video

I decided I would start posting some nature and animal videos that I like to start the blog. I've been busy the past few years and have not had the time I had hoped to write blog posts. Witnessing the miracle of evolution and creation reminds me to take a step back and wonder about it. With this blog, I want to appreciate and notice how things can slowly adapt to changing environments and situations and can evolve in perfectly marvelous ways to fill their little spaces and roles in the ecosystem. Every day I see stuff all around me that seems magical and wondrous like this and it defies belief. I intend to draw attention to our ability to adapt and evolve in various ways every day in little ways as individuals and as a species. Each of us is doing some little wiggle in some larger system, the Geist of our world and times, and it includes every conscious living thing doing their thing. So I'll will just wiggle and waggle here a little bit.

INSECTICON - Los verdaderos Transformers

INSECTICON - Los verdaderos Transformers Increíbles imagenes de insectos antes de emprender vuelo captadas por el camarógrafo aficionado de la vida silvestre Fumihiko Hirai Fumihiko Hirai fb.com/fumihiko.hirai.9

Posted by Liber on Wednesday, July 18, 2018
Much Love! Thank you for your support and encouragement! $
- Link last updated here 2018-12-08 Sat 21:56. Linked site responsible for content. -

entry.title: Moments with the Stars
entry.content:
I'm sitting by myself on a deck at a cabin in Northern Arizona. A few moments ago I was reading about spirals on my phone after looking at some pictures possibly created by the debris of smashed atomic partials. It is about 20 to 25 minutes past midnight Wednesday, July 13th, 2016. I am far away from any nearby city with lights and the moon isn't out yet, so I can see stars very bright and clear twinkling slowly in the blackness of outer space above me. There are bats fluttering around in the night chasing bugs. The wind is blowing gently in the pine trees and on my skin. It is chilly and I shiver a little when a moist breeze blows lightly by my skin, giving me a small flush of goosebumps then fading away. Little insects are tapping the screen behind me and there is a steady rhythm of crickets chirping all around me out in the forest.

I look up again at just the right time to see a good shooting star appear quickly then fade out silently across the sky. I usually make a good wish when I see one. The powerball is up high again… Maybe that one again I say to myself.. But I hesitate. After considering a few.. I'm really not sure… What should I really wish for this time?… I almost died a few weeks ago and I am recovering from an major surgery. I came back from the dead and now I'm out here in the forest at night far away from everyone. And now I just let that wish sit, thinking there must be some other wish more meaningful to make here. The whole thing is so beautiful that I'm suddenly overwhelmed with gratitude.

There is a soft immediate slowly building response in my body awareness field that feels breathtaking. It is a bit like the chills or goosebumps, but more delicate and internal, as if a Higher Consciousness in the Universe was listening to my thoughts and let me feel a loving presence. It is that gentle tingly feeling in my body awareness. It seems mysterious and spiritual. It must be what they call Qi or perhaps a "Holy Ghost." I'm not sure. I have felt it before. It does appear every so often when I'm moved or ponder about certain things in times like these. It seems to like and respond to different thoughts and observations. It is very pleasant.

I take out my camera to see if it can capture the stars, but the camera only records blackness when I point it at the sky. I'll just sit here a while with it. I don't feel alone. I think I'll wish to share it with someone I'm thinking about at the right time. I'll just sit here a while and think about random people I love and imagine them getting it. And I'll try to remember to call it up in my mind whenever I need to remember it or go someplace like this when I forget.

Much Love! Thank you for your support and encouragement! $
- Last Updated 2018-12-08 Sat 21:25. © Daniel DuBois, M.S., M.A. -

entry.title: Welcome to the Blog
entry.content:
Thanks For Visiting My New Website!

I've been playing around with the blog idea for while, setting it up, and testing different generators and editors. I finally settled on a Hexo blog with the Next theme and Emacs for my editor. The Dragon Dictate software seems to have difficulty with selecting and editing the text in Emacs, so I also use the Sublime text editor for dictating text. I write the post in Org mode, which the generator renders as HTML when I export it into hexo. So far I am happy with it. I had a little difficulty getting citations to export into HTML correctly, which led me on a small excursion, but I think I can just edit the HTML to have the correct in-text citations for now.

Now for the writing! For this blog, I plan to write about my experiences providing philosophical counseling and helping people with trance/hypnosis/spirituality/meditation over the past few years. I also plan to write about topics that I'm currently researching or reflecting on – usually things related to philosophy, psychology, politics, culture, personal experiences and other interests. I may repost some of my old articles and papers. When I finish reading an article or a book, I may post a short review or some reflections about it. This will be a casual blog with open discussion about anything. If you have any ideas for things you would like to see discussed, please feel free to post the ideas and questions in the comment sections.

The style for the comments is Internet casual conversational; however, please be polite and constructive when discussing topics with others.

Thanks for checking it out. I hope you find something to enjoy. I'll probably keep tweaking the website for a while, but I hope to have a new post every month or so. You can check out the About section for short bio of my adult career and education.

Much Love! Thank you for your support and encouragement! $
- Last Updated 2018-12-08 Sat 21:30. © Daniel DuBois, M.S., M.A. -

entry.title: About
entry.content:
After completing service in the military, I started out in the IT field. I was an intern for the State of Arizona Government Information Technology Agency (G.I.T.A.) for two summers during the first two years in the Management Information Systems program at the University of Arizona. I collaborated on coding software projects for state agencies and assisted with internal networking and computer hardware maintenance.

For a broader education, I switched and completed a B.A. degree in Philosophy from the University of Arizona with a interests in logic, history and philosophy of science, consciousness, and western analytic philosophy. The degree included an array of other areas in the liberal arts and sciences and a minor in communications.

I then completed a M.S. degree in Psychology from the University of Phoenix while working as a Case Manager at an intensive community mental health clinic. After completing the degree, I moved to northern Arizona and worked for the AZ Department of Economic Security-Division of Developmental Disabilities for a short time before going back to graduate school for a doctorate in Clinical Psychology at the Arizona School of Professional Psychology at Argosy University.

I completed a M.A. degree Degree in Clinical Psychology after three years of full-time coursework and year practicum providing neuropsychological testing. I continued coursework for two more years at Argosy and competed a half-year practicum providing psychotherapy with veterans suffering from Trauma at the VA while also employed working with seniors in home care. Unfortunately, my financial aid ran out right at the end of the program and I wasn’t able to finish. I then worked as a behavioral health technician and now work as a masters level family therapist at a community mental health clinic for people with general mental health concerns. I have worked in the mental health and social services field in various other capacities with many different service populations while pursuing my education. I have continued to work on software development skills as a hobby.

Throughout my career I have enjoyed working with amazing children, adolescents, adults, and seniors from diverse backgrounds. I have developed a strong sense of commitment to improving community support systems and a greater understanding of the difficulties that can emerge at different stages of the lifespan. I continue to hone and utilize skills by researching, teaching, and assisting others.

Much Love! Thank you for your support and encouragement! $
